author: pipermerriam
content: <@!303389476284006402> there really isn't a "language" that core protocol development happens in because the core protocol is agnostic to how it is implemented.  Core protocol is a set of rules.  Clients like geth (go-ethereum) implement these rules (in golang in this case).

author: pipermerriam
content: if you like python: https://github.com/ethereum/py-evm is an implementation of the EVM in python that should be very accessible to read.

author: lightclient

i recommend reading through the yellow paper if you haven't, it's the most complete definition of the eth protocol: https://ethereum.github.io/yellowpaper/paper.pdf

author: pipermerriam
content:
Recommended reading:

- Yellow Paper: https://ethereum.github.io/yellowpaper/paper.pdf  (accompanying cheat sheet: https://github.com/benjaminion/YellowPaper_CheatSheet/blob/master/YPCheatSheet.pdf)
- Research Forums: https://ethresear.ch/
- EIPS: https://eips.ethereum.org/

Expect these to be full of deep and complex topics.  Taking personal notes to track topics you don't understand or that you want to dig into further is recommended.
